content: Swarun Kumar, Sathaye Family Foundation Professor, CMU Swarun Kumar Home Publications Research Low-Power WANs Battery-Free IoT Future Wi-Fi mm-Wave & Beyond 5-G Wireless Sensing Wireless Security Awards Awards and Honors Research Grants Open Source Efforts Outreach Contact ☰ Swarun Kumar Sathaye Family Foundation Professor, Electrical and Computer Engineering Carnegie Mellon University Office: CIC Rm. 4113, 4720 Forbes Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15213 Email: swarun [at] cmu [dot] edu Assistant: Dawn Sienko, Email: dsienko [at] andrew [dot] cmu [dot] edu Phone: (412)-268-9192 I am the Sathaye Family Foundation Professor at Carnegie Mellon University's ECE department, with an affiliate appointment in the CS department, the HCI Institute and Cylab. My research builds next-generation wireless network protocols and services. I lead the Emerging Wireless Technologies (WiTech) lab at CMU. I am a recipient of the 2024 ACM SIGMOBILE Rockstar award, the 2021 SIGBED Early Career Researcher award, the NSF CAREER award and Google Faculty Research award. I received the George Sprowls Award for best Ph.D thesis in Computer Science at MIT and the President of India gold medal at IIT Madras. NEWS Thank you ACM SIGMOBILE for the 2024 SIGMOBILE Rockstar Award Jingxian Wang receives the 2023 ACM SIGMOBILE Doctoral Dissertation Award! Two accepted papers at MobiCom'23 on wireless actuation and spectrum sensing! Two accepted papers at ICRA'23 on soft robots and mmWave sensing! Paper at IPSN'23 on mmWave structural sensing. Three Ph.D. students graduate to join as faculty at UW, UCSD and NUS! Two papers at IROS'22 on robotic sensing using mmWave and Wi-Fi. Our paper on powerline backscatter is accepted at NSDI'22 Our paper on fast RFID localization is accepted at UbiComp'22 Two papers at IPSN'22: Milton and SelfieStick! Two papers at CHI'22: on Privacy Protective Behavior and Lean Privacy Review (TOCHI)! Swarun Kumar receives the CMU-CIT Dean's Early Career Fellowship (2021) Akshay Gadre wins the 2021 ACM SIGBED/SIGSOFT Frank Anger Memorial Award Our work on NFC Textiles wins Best Paper at IPSN 2021 Thank you ACM SIGBED for the 2021 SIGBED Early Career Researcher Award Two papers accepted at IPSN 2021 on LoRa localization and NFC Textiles Vaibhav Singh wins the James Sprague Presidential Fellowship from CIT! Two papers accepted at MobiCom 2021 on mm-wave backscatter and cubesat groundstations Jingxian Wang receives the Microsoft Ph.D. Fellowship Thank you NSF for the CAREER award! Gave a talk on future wireless at TEDxPittsburgh!
